content:
I am a social scientist specializing in nonprofit management and volunteerism. My broader research agenda centers on why citizens participate and persist in the public sphere. My research examines how nonprofit-government interactions and organizational practices, such as diversity management, training, and recognition, affect individual participation and persistence in nonprofit-type activities. My work has been published in Nonprofit Management & Leadership, and Asian Journal of Political Science.
I expect to earn a Ph.D. in Public Affairs from the Oâ€™Neill School, Indiana University-Bloomington in May 2020. I completed an M.P.A. at Indiana University in 2015, and a B.Soc.Sci in Politics and Philosophy at the University of Hong Kong in 2012.
